intro: Physocarpon arvense, commonly known as the field bladderwort, is a small aquatic plant belonging to the family Lentibulariaceae. It is characterized by its tiny, bladder-like structures called bladders, which are used to trap small aquatic organisms. The plant typically grows in shallow, freshwater environments such as ponds and ditches. It has small, opposite leaves and produces small, yellowish flowers. Its unique adaptations make it an important part of aquatic ecosystems.
